title: wa2000_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Walther WA 2000]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] done in a [[half updo]], [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and wears a black [[blazer]], [[red necktie]], [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

A total [[tsundere]] towards everyone. Based off her in-game lines this is due to her viewing herself solely as a weapon and finding it hard to effectively communicate with others as a result. The tone of her lines can also depend based on language, with the JP voice lines being a lot harsher on the tsuntsun than the CN text lines. She's also infamous for being a terrible cook.

She is voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]]. In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], WA2000 appears as [[Makiatto (girls' frontline 2)|]].

title: rpk-16_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[RPK-16]] [[machine gun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. One of the members of team [[DEFY (girls' frontline)|]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[purple eyes]] and wears a [[tactical clothes]], [[black bodysuit]], and [[black shorts]].

She gives the impression of being a cheerful, chatty girl who's very easy-going and comfortable to be around. But when you gradually drop your guard, she will often say bewildering things that astonish you... You will see a whole different side of this Doll as you spend more time with her.

Voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]] and illustrated by [[Duoyuanjun]].

title: nimogen_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A Nyto type that first appeared in the RO635-SOPMODII route of the Isomer event. Wears a full dress unlike the [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s from Continuum Turbulence and is differentiated from her sister [[mercurows (girls' frontline)|Mercurows]] by her sidetail and gold sash.

Has more emotions compared to the less advanced Nytos from Continuum Turbulence. Dislikes being called a Nyto and being grouped together with the others. [spoiler]Gets banished to Tallinn following her failure in Isomer, and gets incorporated into the [[Isomer (girls' frontline)|]]s, becoming part of the [[Isomer Hivemind (girls' Frontline)|]].[/spoiler]

title: isomer_hivemind_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A Nyto type that first appeared in the Shattered Connexion event. The leader of the abandoned [[Isomer (girls' frontline)|]]s, acting as the representative of the Isomer Hivemind that had developed in Tallinn. Called "Failed Isomer" in the in-game Enemy Units Index, with her two forms referred to as "Isomer White" and "Isomer Black" in the community.

Originally [spoiler]an Isomer who took over the body of the discarded [[Nimogen (girls' Frontline)|Nimogen]].[/spoiler] By the end of SC, [spoiler]she and the other Isomers were assimilated by M4A1's OGAS, who then subsequently took over the body and was later dubbed [[Dandelion (girls' frontline)|]].[/spoiler]

title: kamen_rider_zero-one
body:
Titular protagonist of [[kamen rider 01 (series)|Kamen Rider Zero-One]], thirtieth show of the Kamen Rider series and very first of the Reiwa generation, with the accession of Emperor Naruhito at the start of May 2019.

Hiden Aruto is a high-school student and aspiring stage comedian who reluctantly takes up his recently-deceased grandfather's position as president of Hiden Intelligence, Japan's leading specialist in HumaGears, humanoid robots with advanced artificial intelligence, in order to be able to access the president-exclusive powers of Kamen Rider Zero-One and protect humanity from rogue HumaGears hijacked by a cyberterrorist organization, with the aid of a specialized military unit and their own Riders.

As Zero-One, Aruto uses keycard-like Progrise Keys to transform into different animal-themed forms, including his default grasshopper-themed Rising Hopper.

title: 30_rock
body:
30 Rock is an American satirical sitcom created by Tina Fey that aired from October 11, 2006, to January 31, 2013 for seven seasons on NBC.

Based on Tina Fey's experience as a head writer on [[Saturday Night Live]], the series follows Liz Lemon(played by Tina Fey) as head writer and showrunner of the fictional sketch comedy show, TGS with Tracy, located at 30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York(30 Rock), where SNL is produced in [[Real Life]]. 

The show is famous not only for it's surreal humor but also of making fun of the tv network the show airs on, NBC, and the corporate owners of the network, General Electric and Comcast.

title: imminent_uno_loss_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on an image of a woman playing an [[Uno (game)|]] card game, smiling confidently as she has only one card left in her hand. However, her opponent's hand is full of Draw 4 (and sometimes Draw 2) cards that can easily defeat her.

Sometimes, the hand is substituted with [b]all five pieces of [[Exodia the Forbidden One]][/b], which results in an instant win when revealed in [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]

Spiked in popularity with the release of [[mimukauwa_nice_try_(vocaloid)|Mimukauwa Nice Try]], a song that features Miku undergoing this exact fate.

title: live_a_live
body:
A 1994 Super Famicom role-playing game developed by Square. The game was initially a failure compared to Final Fantasy, selling only 270,000 copies. However, the HD remake for Nintendo Switch in 2022 and other platforms in 2023 sold 500,000 copies within 3 months and revived interest in the game and its unique systems.

title: oersted
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of The Middle Ages: The Lord of Dark chapter. A knight of the Kingdom of Lucrece who embarked on a journey to rescue Princess [[Alethea]], who was abducted by the Lord of Dark.

[spoilers]At the end of the Middle Ages chapter, Oersted renounces his former ties and titles from Lucrece and took on the name "Odio", accepting his unwanted role as a demon and becoming the Lord of Dark after losing the faith of the people of Lucrece and having no one left to believe in him.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]He, as [[Demon King Odio|Odio, the Lord of Dark]], is playable in the Final Chapter if he is chosen as the protagonist. He is also playable for one turn at the very end of the 2022 remake's true final boss, dealing the final blow to the Sin of Odio.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] in the 2022 remake.
other_names: オルステッド(ライブアライブ)

title: nunholy
body: A small [[hades_(series)|Hades-like]] game developed and published by [[Chowbie]].

title: streibough
body:
Character in [[Live A Live]]'s Middle Ages chapter. Wizard of Lucrece and [[Oersted]]'s closest companion for most of his journey to rescue Princess [[Alethea]] from the clutches of the Lord of Dark.

[spoilers]It is revealed that Streibough is the hidden main antagonist of the Middle Ages chapter, being responsible for the regicide of the King of Lucrece by Oersted's hand by masking the King's appearance as the Lord of Dark and Oersted's descent into becoming [[Demon King Odio|Odio]].[/spoilers]

[spoilers]His soul can be found in the Trial of Heart in the Dominion of Hate, questioning if he is to blame for Oersted's descent into becoming the Lord of Dark.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Hodoshima Shizuma in the 2022 remake.

title: alethea
body:
Character in [[Live A Live]]'s Middle Ages chapter. The princess of the Kingdom of Lucrece who was abducted by the Lord of Dark pretty early in the chapter, prompting [[Oersted]] to embark on a journey to save her.

[spoilers]At the end of the Middle Ages chapter, she dumped Oersted for [[Streibough]], telling the former he came to save her too late. She kills herself in front of Oersted, her corpse laying on top of Streibough's. This is one of the reasons for Oersted's descent into becoming the Lord of Dark, [[Demon King Odio|Odio]].[/spoilers]

[spoilers]Her soul appears in the Trial of Heart in the Dominion of Hate after obtaining the Guts and Glory Glove, begging for the protagonists to stop Oersted, telling them that he doesn't know what he has become.[/spoilers]

She is voiced by [[Arakawa Miho]] in the 2022 remake.
other_names: アリシア(ライブアライブ)

title: vyshyvanka
body: Vyshyvanka is a casual name for the embroidered shirt in Ukrainian and Belarusian national costumes. Ukrainian vyshyvankas are distinguished by embroidery features specific to Ukrainian embroidery.

title: mavka
body:
Mavka (Ukrainian: Мавка) also Nyavka (Ukrainian: Нявка) is a type of female spirit in Ukrainian folklore and mythology. The Mavka is a long-haired figure, a Soul of the Forest, typically depicted as temptress figures who lure men to their deaths.

The spirits known by this term represented the souls of girls who had died unnatural, tragic or premature deaths, particularly unchristened babies. Mavkas often appear in the form of beautiful young girls who entice and lure young men into the woods, where they "tickle" them to death. Mavkas have no reflection in water, nor do they cast shadows. In some accounts, they were also said to help farmers by looking after cattle and driving out wild animals.

title: uranohoshi_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students who attend the Uranohoshi Girls' High School in [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]], it's a [[serafuku]] and comes in 3 versions.

The main [[summer uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]], [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[grey sailor collar|sailor]] blouse and a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and a [[neckerchief]] with a [[tie clip]]. The neckerchief may also be colored according to class year: students who first enter high school in Season 1 wear [[yellow neckerchief|yellow]], those in their second year wear [[red neckerchief|red]], and those in their third year wear [[aqua neckerchief|aqua]].

The [[winter uniform]] replaces the light blouse with a thicker [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[double-breasted]] one and the neckerchief with a [[bowtie]] matching their neckerchief (although [[Matsuura Kanan|the]] [[kurosawa dia|third]] [[ohara mari|years]] opt to keep the neckerchief instead).

There is also an alternate [[black serafuku]] version of the winter uniform with a [[white neckerchief]] and [[tie clip]], featured in [[love live! sunshine!! the school idol movie over the rainbow|the movie]].

title: kamen_rider_drive
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_drive_(series)|Kamen Rider Drive]], twenty-fifth show in the Kamen Rider series and sixteenth of the Heisei generation.

[[Tomari Shinnosuke]] was an ace police detective demoted to a special investigations division due to dismotivation following an incident where one of his colleagues was crippled. When his new team was assigned to look after cases of people suddenly becoming immobile, however, Shinnosuke was given a chance to reignite his passion with the super-car Tridoron and its sentient belt to transform into Kamen Rider Drive and fight the Roidmudes, monsters connected to the freezing incidents.

In a departure from series tradition, Drive is the first Rider to primarily use a car for transportation, and uses Shift Cars to either change his appearance and/or arsenal.

title: forbidden_gundam
body:
[b]GAT-X252 Forbidden Gundam[/b]

A second generation GAT-X mobile suit, the Forbidden gundam was a monstrous assault mobile suit, dedicated to devastating high-speed assaults against enemy fortifications and bases. It bore several unique weapons and systems including: two arm mounted 115mm machine guns, two 88mm backpack mounted railguns, a devastatingly powerful "Plasma Induction Cannon" capable of total annihilation of targets, worst yet the beam could  [b][i]bend[/i][/b] in order to hit moving targets. And finally a heavy scythe for close combat. The entire MS was protected by the now near standard trans-phase shift armor and a powerful electromagnetic field generator known as Geschmeidig Panzer. This unit was deployed by the Terrorist organization [[Blue Cosmos]] and was finally destroyed in combat by [[Yzak Joule]] and his [[Duel Gundam]].
other_names: フォビドゥンガンダム

title: elira_pendora
body:
A [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the first wave [[LazuLight]] and designed by [[Kamameshi Gougoumaru]]. She is canonically (but not IRL) the elder sister of [[Selen Tatsuki]], who debuted in the 2nd batch of Nijisanji EN.

Elira has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]],  [[multicolored hair|with]] [[white hair|white trim]],  [[blue wings|blue]] [[head wings]], [[x hair ornament]] and [[bangs]] [[one eye covered|covering]] her [[hair over one eye|left eye]]. Her right eye is [[aqua eyes|aqua]], while her character sheet revealed that she shares her sister's [[heterochromia]] with her left eye being [[purple eyes|purple]]. She also has prominent [[fangs]].

title: kirby_(series)
body:
Video game series by [[Nintendo]] and [[HAL Laboratory]]. Known in Japan as [b]Hoshi no Kirby[/b] (Kirby of the Stars). Best known for its surprisingly dark lore despite the game's overall cute asthetics.

There is also an anime adaptation that goes by the same name in Japan. When it was dubbed in English, it was given another name: [[kirby:_right_back_at_ya|Kirby: Right Back At Ya!]]

This tag shares the same Pixiv tag with [[Kirby's Dream Land]]. Please keep this in mind when adding copyright tags for [i]Kirby[/i] art.

title: whispy_woods
body:
A recurring boss in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series, Whispy Woods is usually the first boss enemy [[Kirby]] has to face in his adventures. He is known for being one of the easiest bosses for Kirby to fight - He's a (usually) stationary tree that drops apples on Kirby to attack, so all Kirby has to do is inhale the apples that drop and spit them back at him while standing next to him to avoid the air bullets he spits out. Whispy has appeared in many games ever since the very first one and sometimes takes a spot other than Level 1 in a game, and sometimes even changes strategy and gains new attacks, but that doesn't make him any tougher. A similar boss named King Golem who appears in Kirby & The Amazing Mirror also shares the same attack pattern as Whispy.

In the [[kirby:_right_back_at_ya|anime]], Whispy takes a different role. Instead of being a major enemy, Whispy serves as an ally to Kirby and his friends. He is very kind to his friends, yet shows no mercy to those who threaten his kingdom and forest. At first, he thought Kirby and his friends were intruders and tried to crush them as punishment. But after realizing [[King Dedede]] used him, Whispy becomes Kirby's friend while Dedede tries many times to cut down his forest (yet fails every time). In the [[Super Smash Bros.]] games, Whispy appears in the background, often minding his own business before taking deep breaths and then blowing strong winds that push players close to the edges of the Kirby stages he is placed in.

For more info, see his "wiki page":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Whispy_Woods.

body:

title: dottore_(genshin_impact)
body:
Il Dottore, also known by his codename "The Doctor", is the second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and a major antagonist in [[Genshin Impact]]. He first appeared in the supplementary manga before his first in-game appearance.

Prior to becoming a Fatui Harbinger, he was a researcher from Sumeru known as [b]Zandik[/b]. He was exiled from his homeland for performing unethical experiments and "enhancing" humans. [[Pierro (genshin impact)|]] would later recruit him to join the Fatui. He finds his name "humorously ironic."

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, he is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

title: ayakashi_triangle
body:
Ayakashi Triangle, sometimes abbreviated as AyaTri, is a 2020-to-2023 Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Yabuki Kentarou]]. It has been serialized by publisher Shueisha since June 2020, changing from [[shounen jump|Weekly Shōnen Jump]] magazine to Shōnen Jump+ in April 2022.

The series focuses on exorcist ninja [[Kazamaki Matsuri]], as he tries to defend his childhood friend, the Ayakashi Medium [[Kanade Suzu]], from evil spirits called ayakashi. However, during a battle to save Suzu's life, Matsuri is turned into a girl after being cursed by [[Shirogane (ayatora)|]], the King of Ayakashi. With Suzu's help, Matsuri must adjust to his new feminine form as they deal with both the friendly and the malicious ayakashi they encounter, as well as their growing feelings for each other, all while trying to break Matsuri's curse for him to return to his original form.

h4.Characters

h5.Main Characters

title: chronicle_of_myers
body:
The [i]Chronicle of Myers[/i] series (also known as Myers Mythology, or Ogiverse) is a Chinese-language online series created by [[Jo Shin Ogi]], broadly labeled on Danbooru under the title of the first work in the series, Chronicle of Myers. Most information about the series is only available in Chinese, whether it be the works contained within or encyclopedic.

Below are linked articles from the Chinese Ogiverse Wikia on each of the works under Myers.

h4. Titles in the Myers series

title: signora_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character. Also known by the codename "The Fair Lady", she is the eighth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and a major antagonist in [[Genshin Impact]].

Her real name is Rosalyne-Kruzchka Lohefalter. In her previous life, after the death of her lover, Rostam, she swore revenge against those who were responsible for his death, eventually becoming the [b]Crimson Witch of Flames[/b]. Upon joining the Fatui, she was bestowed with a Delusion to suppress her flames.

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, she is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

title: sun_quan
body:
[b]Sun Quan[/b] (孫權), courtesy name [b]Zhongmou[/b] (仲謀), posthumously known as Emperor Da of Wu (吳大帝), was the founder of the [[Eastern Wu|Eastern Wu dynasty]], one of the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms of China]]. 

After [[Sun Jian|Sun Jian's]] death in the early 190s, he and his family lived at various cities on the lower Yangtze River, until Sun Ce carved out a warlord regime in the Jiangdong region, based on his own followers and a number of local clan allegiances. When [[Sun Ce]] was assassinated, Sun Quan inherited the lands southeast of the Yangtze River from his brother. 

In winter of 207, the northern warlord [[Cao Cao]] led an army of approximately 220,000 to conquer the south to complete the reunification of China. Two distinct factions emerged at his court on how to handle the situation. One, led by [[Zhang Zhao]], urged surrender whilst the other, led by [[Zhou Yu]] and [[Lu Su]] and with support from a diplomatic mission by [[Zhuge Liang]], opposed Cao Cao. Eventually Sun Quan decided to ally with Liu Bei and employing the combined strategies of Zhou Yu and [[Huang Gai]], they defeated Cao Cao decisively at the Battle of Red Cliffs.

In late 220, [[Cao Pi]], King of Wei, Cao Cao's son and successor, seized the throne and proclaimed himself to be the Emperor of China, ending and succeeding the nominal rule of the Han dynasty. At first Sun Quan nominally served as a Wei vassal with the Wei-created title of King of Wu, but after Cao Pi demanded that he send his son [[Sun Deng]] as a hostage to the Wei capital Luoyang and he refused and declared himself independent by changing his era name. It was not until May 229 that he formally declared himself emperor.

After the death of his original crown prince, Sun Deng, two opposing factions supporting different potential successors slowly emerged. Sun Quan harshly settled the conflict between the two factions by exiling [[Sun He]] and forcing [[Sun Ba]] to commit suicide. Sun Quan died in May 252 at the age of 70 (by East Asian reckoning). He enjoyed the longest reign among all the founders of the Three Kingdoms and was succeeded by his son, [[Sun Liang]]. 

h4. Adaptations in popular media

* [[sun quan (sangokushi taisen)|Sun Quan]] from [[Sangokushi Taisen]]
* [[sun quan (shin sangoku musou)|Sun Quan]] from [[Shin Sangoku Musou]]
* [[Sonken Chuubou (sangoku hime)|Sonken Chuubou]] from [[Sangoku Hime]]
* [[Sonken (koihime musou)|Sonken "Renfa" Chuubou]] from [[Koihime Musou]]
* [[Sonken Chuubou|Shoukyou (Sonken Chuubou)]] from [[Ikkitousen]]

title: jaune_arc
body:
Jaune Arc is a male character from [[RWBY]], a 3DCG Series created by [[roosterteeth|Rooster Teeth]]. 

Jaune is the "J" in team JNPR and the leader of the team. His design and name are inspired by [[jeanne_d'arc|Joan of Arc]].

h4.Abilities

He wields a [[shield]] and [[sword]] collectively named [[crocea_mors_(rwby)| Crocea Mors]], which when combined together can become a even larger and wider sword. [spoiler]His semblance is Aura Amplifier, which lets him amplify his or someone else's aura; this can help people heal faster and use their semblances for longer.[/spoiler]

h4.Physical characteristics

Jaune is a 6'1" male who has short [[blonde_hair | blonde hair]] with [[blue_eyes | blue eyes]].

h4. Attire 

He wears a white [[breastplate]] with a gold outline and a [[black_hoodie | black hoodie]] underneath it. He also has [[armor]] on the side of both of his shoulders and below his elbow, continuing until it gets to his hand where it turns gold. he wears blue jeans that are tucked in to his [[brown_footwear | brown boots]].

h4. Relevant Tags
[[RWBY]]
Brown boots --> [[brown_footwear]]
[[short_hair]] 
[[blonde_hair]]
[[black_hoodie]]
[[armor]]


h4. External Links

https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Jaune_Arc

title: feixiao_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Accompanied by [[Ecliptic Inner Beast (honkai: Star Rail)|]] in her Echo of War (weekly boss) version.

One of the seven generals of the Xianzhou Alliance and the commander of the Verdant Knights of the Yaoqing. Voiced by [[Komatsu Mikako]] in Japanese.

She is a [[fox girl]] with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient end]], [[blue eyes]], [[eyeshadow]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[blue shirt]] worn alongside a [[wave print]] [[grey jacket]], [[white belt]], [[black shorts]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. Unlike other Foxians, she does not have a [[fox tail]].

h4. Profile

"'The Merlin's Claw' is what's written in the books, and 'The Great General' is what people call me. The former sounds too formal, the latter too exaggerated. Neither suits me. I prefer my own title, the 'Lacking General' — lacking in worries, regrets, and rivals."

The Xianzhou Yaoqing's Merlin's Claw and one of the Seven Arbiter-Generals. Her personality is unrestrained and frank, dashing and straightforward. She is skilled in all forms of martial arts and has honed herself into a supreme weapon. She is widely adored by Xianzhou soldiers and civilians alike as "The Great General."

However, she bears the burden of the Moon Rage affliction. If she were to hunt down all the abominations in her limited lifetime — Then the only enemy Feixiao has would be herself.

title: mii_(nintendo)
body:
User avatars for [[Nintendo]]'s [[Wii]], [[nintendo 3ds|3DS]], and [[Wii U]] video game systems, appearing too on the [[Nintendo Switch]] in a lesser capacity. Typically [[chibi]] characters, sometimes without legs or arms (though inclusive of hands).

The Wii and the Wii U each have a unique set of Miis that appear as CPUs in Nintendo's games, the most well-known of the Wii set being [[Matt (wii)|]] (マット). However, Nintendo does make unique original Miis when needed; for instance, [[Nikki (swapnote)|]] for [[Swapnote]] and [[Sheila Bell]] for [[Surechigai Meikyuu]].

Numerous Nintendo games, such as [[Mario Kart]] (since Mario Kart Wii) and [[Super Smash Bros.]] allow players to use their Miis as playable characters. In the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series, the generic Miis used to represent the [[Mii Brawler|Brawler]], [[Mii Gunner|Gunner]], and [[Mii Swordfighter|Swordfighter]] types are shown to be based off the default Miis Guest C, Guest F, and Guest B.

Spiritually succeeded by the [[Sportsmate (nintendo)|]]s of [[Nintendo Switch Sports]], even if you can still play with and against Miis in that game.

h4. See also

* [[Mii Brawler]]
* [[Mii Gunner]]
* [[Mii Swordfighter]]

It is [[Mint Choco Cookie]]'s first [[cookie run: ovenbreak|Ovenbreak]] costume. The costume is based loosely on [[Erik (Phantom of the Opera)]].

title: greyscale_with_colored_background
body:
An image where the subject is in [[greyscale]] but the background is colored. It's usually also a [[simple background]].

Do not tag these as [[greyscale]], [[partially colored]] or [[spot color]].

If parts of the image other than the background are colored, such as the subject's eyes, [[spot color]] can be used. If the subject has enough coloring on itself that you'd tag it [[partially colored]], simply use that tag instead and do not tag it as greyscale with colored background.

h4. Examples

* !post #5782342
* !post #5576860

h4. See also

* [[monochrome background]]

title: partially_colored
body:
Some parts of a picture are colored, while others remain uncolored, left as a sketch or lineart. This is either because the image is [[unfinished]], or as way to draw attention to a subject.

For images that employ emphasis by use of limited colors, see [[spot color]] instead.

For posts where the only colored part is the background, use [[greyscale with colored background]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #5797637
* !post #7757806
* !post #5782023

h4. See also

* [[flat color]]
* [[Tag group:Colors]]

title: amaya_tsubame
body:
A character from [[Gakuen Idolmaster]], voiced by Yukari Amane (天音ゆかり Amane Yukari).

The vice president of Hatsuboshi Academy's student council and its current No.2 idol. Prideful of her abilities, she takes on a more pompous attitude. Though she's strict with herself and others, she's good at looking after them. She's a childhood friend and rival with [[juo_sena|Sena]], and has stated that she would surpass her and become "Prima Stella" in the future.

title: five-seven_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[FN Five-SeveN]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has a [[long hair|long]], [[grey hair|grey]] to [[white hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a black [[pleated skirt]], a black [[jacket]] [[off shoulder|off the shoulder]], a [[thigh strap]] and a [[rabbit hair ornament]].

A cheerful girl, Five-SeveN's quotes show a deep affection towards the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]], such as asking for a hug at the end of a logistics mission, or asking if the Commander missed her when logging in.

Part of [[FAL (girls' frontline)|]]'s unit "Team FN" in-story, and is second-in-command of her team.

title: kar98k_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[mauser 98|Mauser Kar98K]] bolt-action [[rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[pink eyes]], and wears a [[black hat]] with the [[Iron Cross]], [[black skirt]], a large [[jacket on shoulders|coat over her shoulders]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh]] [[boots]]. Infamously, her official art portrays her with a comically [[oversized object|oversized]] Kar98k, which has led to some fanart depicting her as quite small. 

Her portrait is used as the game's app icon, and she features with [[Lee-Enfield (girls' frontline)|]] in the initial loading screen. Despite this focus in early promotional material, her illustrator [[Samail]] did not contribute much for her for years due to outside factors. Would receive a [[Kar98K (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

title: agent_(girls'_frontline)
body:
First [[Sangvis Ferri]] android seen in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Holding a high position as all combat units are obedient to her commands. She is a master of both combat and command, capable of strategic coordination.

Serene and indifferent, she speaks and acts in a tidy manner. Her language is always respectful even towards her enemy, but she will give harsh titles to anyone other than her master, especially to Griffin & Kryuger.

Agent has [[grey eyes]], [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[black hair]] put up in large [[double bun]]s, and short black [[horns]]. There is a device on her back with a [[cable]] extending from it that plugs into an external [[collar]]. Her armament, hidden beneath a long [[dress]], consists of four boxy [[gun]] barrels on [[mechanical arms]] connected to her hips and legs on the thighs.

She wears a [[maid]] uniform that consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] underneath a long [[black dress]] with [[frilled dress|frilled trim]], [[black gloves]], a [[maid headdress]], [[black panties]], a black [[garter belt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]] that go either to the [[thigh boots|thigh]] or the [[knee boots|knee]], depending on the artist.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3511503: Default
* !post #4535832: 5* Protocol Assimilation

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Agent":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Agent]
other_names: エージェント(ドールズフロントライン)

title: 9a-91_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[9A-91]] rifle in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]], tied into [[low twintails]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and wears a [[blue dress]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] front, exposing her [[navel]] and [[black panties|panties]]. She also wears a red [[scarf]], red [[beret]] and black [[thighhighs]]. She dons a red [[star hair ornament]] in her standard skin, a likely nod to her USSR origins.

Being designed around a suppressed weapon, 9A-91 is depicted as speaking rather softly. Many of her voice lines show her constantly seeking the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]]'s attention and approval. In her OATH lines, she outright confirms this to be her one desire. She seems to be on friendly terms with [[AS Val (girls' frontline)|]] and [[AK-74U (girls' frontline)|]].

She is voiced by [[Nakahara Mai]].

title: g41_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K G41]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[cat ears]], [[heterochromia]] (right eye blue, left eye red), and wears white lingerie, long [[black gloves]] and [[thighhighs]]. There are however some differing opinions on whether her limbs and eye might be cybernetics or not.

According to her artist ([[ns (ntrsis)|]]), "I don't know if she's a cat, a dog or a fox..."

She is voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

title: mdr_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A T-Doll (android) that is armed with (and thus representing) the [[Desert Tech MDR]], the "Micro Dynamic Rifle", in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[one side up]], atop which she wears a [[beret]]. MDR has [[heterochromia]]. Like most T-Doll characters, she is seen wearing [[tactical clothes]], paired with a [[backpack]]. She also wears [[gloves]] and [[black pantyhose]].

Her official artwork shows her carrying a [[flip phone|mobile phone]], and she's often characterized as a massive shitposter with an online following. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], MDR appears as [[Kuro (neural cloud)|]].

title: negev_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[IMI Negev]] light machine gun in [[Girls' Frontline]]. Her illustrator is [[Heiwari Kanade]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[red bow]], a [[braid]], and [[hairclip|hairclips]] shaped like the [[Star of David]]. She has [[red eyes]] and wears a white jacket, [[white gloves]], [[white skirt]], and [[black pantyhose]]. Since the Negev was developed in [[Israel]], she has strong ties to the country, and as well as the other dolls which wield guns from there.

She is voiced by [[Suwa Ayaka]].

title: dialogue_box
body:
A pop-up message on a screen, usually at the bottom. This is typically used in a visual novel or RPG games either to narrate the story or to represent character's dialogue.

Not to be confused with [[speech bubble]], which refers to a dialogue box stylized from comic and manga.

h4. See also

* [[dialogue options]]
* [[user interface]]
* [[error message]]
* [[visual novel]]
* [[gameplay mechanics]]
* [[speech bubble]]
other_names: メッセージウインドウ

title: breast_slider
body: A [[gameplay mechanics|gameplay mechanic]] involving a slider bar in a character creation that allows customization for [[breasts|breast]] sizes.

title: zeno_(dragon_ball)
body:
A supporting character first debuted in [[Dragon Ball Super]].

[b]Zeno[/b] is the "King of All", the supreme ruler of the multiverse and the most powerful being in the entire [[Dragon Ball]] franchise. He is often seen with [[clone|future counterpart of himself]] and co-ruled the multiverse together.

title: tomboy_childhood_friend_(cccpo)
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[cccpo]]. Her name is Hayakawa Mutsuki (早川睦月).

She is a [[tomboy]] with [[brown eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]], and [[large breasts]].

She has been seen wearing a [[black one-piece swimsuit|black]] [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece]] [[swimsuit]], and/or a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]].

title: soviet_army
body:
The [b]Workers' and Peasants' Red Army[/b], or more known by their shortened name Red Army, was the prime land warfare forces of the [[soviet|Union of Soviet Socialist Republic]]. It was established in 1917 and was in service until 1946 when the army took the official name of "Soviet Army", It was then in service until its dissolution in 1991 following the dissolution of the Soviet Union. The remaining bulk of the military would be integrated into the Russian Armed Forces.

h4.See also
* [[World War II]]
* [[Cold War]]
* [[VDV]]
* [[Soviet Border Troops]]
* [[Soviet Navy]]
* [[Soviet Air Force]]
* [[Soviet Militsiya]]
* Wiki articles: "Workers' and Peasants' Red Army":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army] & "Soviet Army":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Army

title: score
body:
A tally system that counts points in numbers. It can be used to decide the winner of a competition (games, sports, etc.) or a single counter that decides the final result one got in something (exams, single-player game, etc.).

Applicable to both real life and video game examples. The numbers must be clearly seen to represent points the player(s) achieve during a play, and it's still ongoing.

See [[musical staff]] or [[sheet music]] for music scores.

h4. See also

* [[ranking]] - The final result of a score, can be represented with numbers or letters.

title: musical_staff
body:
A set of five horizontal lines and four spaces that each represent a different musical pitch or, in the case of a percussion staff, different percussion instruments. Appropriate [[musical note]]s, depending upon the intended effect, are placed on the staff according to their corresponding pitch or function. Musical notes are placed by pitch, percussion notes are placed by instrument, and rests and other symbols are placed by convention.

When on paper, this is tagged as [[sheet music]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #24648632: Staff with [[treble clef]]

h4. See also

* [[sheet music]]
* [[musical note]]
* [[musical staff print]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Staff (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Staff_(music)

title: no._21_(pgr)
body:
A playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], a member of Cerberus squadron, gloomy and emotionless, almost robotic in her conversation responses, however she can act viciously and dangerous when provoked. Voiced by [[Minase Inori]].

No.21 has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] and [[grey eyes]], hair features includes [[sidelocks]], [[hair intakes]] and a single [[ahoge]].

h4. List of playable frames of No. 21

* [[no.21: XXI (punishing: gray raven)|No.21: XXI]]
* [[no. 21: feral scent (pgr)|No.21: Feral Scent]]

title: no._21:_xxi_(solar_frost)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[No. 21 (pgr)|]]'s [[no. 21: xxi (pgr)|XXI frame]].

The Solar Frost coating retains her [[unkempt]] [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]], with features such as [[long bangs]], [[hair intakes]] and a strand of [[ahoge]], [[low twintails]] tied by two mechanical components. Both of her [[grey eyes]] are visible, but her skin complexion is still [[pale skin|pale]]. Featuring two [[tattoo]]s on her body, a [[text tattoo|text]] and [[barcode tattoo]] on the back of her left shoulder ([[back tattoo]]), a [[musical staff]] and [[musical note]]s tattoo on her right thigh ([[leg tattoo]]). Two [[starfish]] are attached on her left thigh. Her toenails are [[toenail polish|painted]] [[orange nails|orange]].

Her [[swimsuit]] is a [[black one-piece swimsuit|black]] [[casual one-piece swimsuit]] with a [[backless swimsuit|backless design]]. Suspended to a [[frills|frilled]] [[black choker]] with a single strap on the front, and two strings to a single strap at the back, and a [[bowtie]] on the front. Other apparel elements include: [[very long sleeves|very long]] [[detached sleeves]], [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on her head]], a single [[fishnet socks|fishnet sock]] on her left foot, and low heeled [[sandals]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6815455

title: signet_of_gold
body: A symbol used in the Elysian Realm mode of [[Honkai_Impact_3rd|Honkai Impact 3rd]], associated with [[Eden_(honkai_impact)|Eden]]. It depicts a [[coin]] embossed with a [[chalice]] design, shown amidst [[musical staff|score lines]] and various [[musical_note|musical notes]].

title: musical_note
body:
Used when a character is [[singing]] or carefree. Can also be used to cover musical notes in the background or on objects.  Covers all musical notation symbols beyond just notes.

h4. Tagged notes (beamed, rest and dotted)
* [[whole note]] (𝅝)
** [[whole rest]] (𝄻)
* [[half note]] (𝅗𝅥)
** [[half rest]] (𝄼)
** [[dotted half note]]
* [[quarter note]] (♩)
** [[quarter rest]] (𝄽)
** [[dotted quarter note]]
* [[eighth note]] (♪)
** [[beamed eighth notes]] (♫)
** [[eighth rest]] (𝄾)
** [[dotted eighth note]]
* [[sixteenth note]] (𝅘𝅥𝅯)
** [[beamed sixteenth notes]] (♬)
** [[sixteenth rest]] (𝄿)
** [[dotted sixteenth note]]
* [[thirty-second note]]
** [[beamed thirty-second notes]]
** [[thirty-second rest]]
** [[dotted thirty-second note]]
* [[sixty-fourth note]]
** [[beamed sixty-fourth notes]] (two or more 64th notes)
* [[ghost note]] (a note of any length with no discernable pitch)
* [[grace note]] 

[b]Although there are notes beyond the 64th note, it isn't necessary to tag them here.[/b]

h4. Tagged other musical notation

h6.Accidentals
* [[flat sign]] (♭, one semitone lower pitch)
* [[double flat sign]] (two semitones lower pitch)
* [[natural sign]] (♮, cancels previous accidental)
* [[sharp sign]] (♯, one semitone higher pitch)

h6.Articulation marks
* [[accent mark]] (>)
* [[fermata]] (𝄐)
* [[marcato (music)|]] (∧)
* [[staccato]]
* [[tenuto]]

h6.Clefs
* [[bass clef]] (𝄢)
* [[treble clef]] (𝄞)

h6.Dynamics
* [[forte (symbol)|forte]]
* [[fortissimo]]
* [[piano (symbol)|]]

h6.Miscellaneous
* [[coda sign]]
* [[segno sign]]
* [[sheet music]]
* [[simile mark]]
* [[musical staff]] (𝄚𝄚𝄚𝄚𝄚)
* [[time signature]]

h4.See also

* [[musical note hair ornament]]

title: musical_staff_print
body:
[[tag group:attire|Clothing]] item or object that has [[musical staff|musical staff]] pattern on it.

h1. See also
* [[musical note print]]
* [[Tag Group:Prints]]

title: marcato_(music)
body:
In musical notation, the marcato symbol is an open vertical wedge (∧) written above or below the [[musical staff|staff]]. It is meant to denote that a note, chord or passage is to be played more forcefully or loudly.

For the horizontal version of the wedge (<), see [[accent mark]].

title: whole_rest
body:
A [[musical note]] denoting a rest (pause) for the length of a whole note. Visually, it appears as a filled in rectangle placed directly below one of the [[musical staff]] lines.

If it is placed directly above one of the staff lines, it is a [[half rest]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20779041

h4. See also

* [[whole note]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Whole note (rest)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whole_note
* "Wikipedia: Rest (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music)

title: akamatsu_kaede
body:
The Ultimate Pianist, and protagonist of [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]]. Used to be called a "Piano Idiot" when she was younger thanks to her constant diligence. Kaede is optimistic and proactive, acting as a leader figure among the students and hoping to cooperate with them to stop the killing game.

She has [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] on top, and wears [[musical note hair ornament]]s. Her school uniform consists of a purple [[sweater vest]] with an orange [[necktie]], along with a purple [[pleated skirt]] with a [[musical staff|musical staff]] print. Also tends to wear a white [[randoseru]].

body:

If the musical notes and symbols are not on paper, use [[musical staff]] instead.

title: kasane_teto_(sv)
body:
[[utau|UTAUloid]] [[Kasane Teto]]'s updated voicebank under the [[Synthesizer V]] engine, announced after her 15th anniversary in April 2023. Her design for this voicebank was illustrated by [[sakauchi waka]].

Along with her usual [[red hair|red]] [[twin drills]], her hair sports a [[white bow]] on her left drill. She wears a uniform consisting of a [[double-breasted]] [[grey jacket]] with [[shoulder boards]] and [[shoulder belt]], and a [[grey skirt]]. Both have a [[red trim]] and [[striped|stripes]] resembling [[musical staff|music staff]]. She wears [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]].

h4. Official art

* !post #6195000
* !post #6195834: reference sheet

h4. See also

* [[List of vocal synth derivatives]]

title: half_rest
body:
A [[musical note]] denoting a rest (pause) for the length of a half note. Visually, it appears as a filled in rectangle placed directly above one of the [[musical staff]] lines.

If it is placed directly below one of the staff lines, it is a [[whole rest]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20779047

h4. See also

* [[half note]]
* [[dotted half note]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Half note (rest)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Half_note
* "Wikipedia: Rest (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music)

This is a list of the disambiguation wiki pages for terms that refer to multiple tags. One use of this list is for finding and retagging posts that use such tags. Another is to prepare in case we eventually decide to implement an ambiguous tag color code.

h4. Tags in Current Use

These tags are potentially ambiguous, but are in widespread use to identify an object, term or character. They also double as disambiguation pages to guide to similarly named tags. Further discussion is needed to determine if qualifiers would be needed, as not every tag listed necessarily needs a qualifier. Their current use is denoted in brackets. If the tag gets changed, please remove it from this portion of the page and move it appropriately.

title: moira_(nijisanji)
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber|Vtuber]], part of the inaugural batch of eight.

A somewhat mischievous goddess with a gentle demeanor.

She has [[blue hair]], [[large breasts]] and a mole [[mole under mouth|near her mouth]] and [[mole on breast|on her breast]].
Usually dressed in a form-fitting [[white dress]] with [[feathered wings]] on her back.

Character design by [[Nezumidoshi]]. Her nickname is [b]Moimoi[/b].

h4. Costumes

* !post #3500213: [[Moira (1st costume) (Nijisanji)|Default]]
* [[Moira (2nd costume) (Nijisanji)|2nd costume]]

title: bass_clef
body:
The musical symbol (𝄢) used to designate notes on the bass staff, or in layman's terms, the lower range of notes. This most common of clefs is associated with bass voices, contrabass (a.k.a. [[double bass]]), bass guitar and other low-pitched instruments.

Also known as the [b]F clef[/b].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20715609

h4. See also

* [[treble clef]] (𝄞)
* [[musical note]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bass Clef":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clef#Bass_clef

title: treble_clef
body:
The musical symbol (𝄞) used to designate notes on the treble staff, or in layman's terms, the upper range of notes. This most common of clefs is associated with soprano and alto voices, violin, flute and many other high-pitched instruments. In art, the treble clef is sometimes used as a general symbol for music.

Also known as the [b]G clef[/b].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20715611

h4. See also

* [[bass clef]] (𝄢)
* [[musical note]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Treble Clef":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clef#Treble_clef

title: hasumi_souji_(eroe)
body:
Character in [[eroe]]'s [[Seitenkango. Shinyuu to]].

Best friend of [[igarashi kyou (eroe)|Kyou]], he is the only one who knows his best friend was transformed into a woman.

title: igarashi_kyou_(eroe)
body:
Character in [[eroe]]'s [[Seitenkango. Shinyuu to]].

Born a boy, Kyou contracted a mysterious disease which [[genderswap|turned him into a woman!]] However, she continues to live and [[reverse trap|dress as a boy]]. Only her best friend [[hasumi souji (eroe)|Souji]] knows the truth.

title: sotheby
body:
[b]Sotheby[/b] is a female Arcanist in [[Reverse:1999]].

Originally from the 1920s, Sotheby is a wealthy young lady that specializes in potion making. She is very curious and knowledgeable, but lacks common sense. She has a butler called [[Mr. Karson]]. After meeting [[Sonetto (Reverse:1999)|Sonetto]], she agreed to help her and [[Vertin (Reverse:1999)|]] in escaping the enemy and curing mass hallucinations caused by the impending "Storm". After being rescued from the "Storm", she joined Vertin's group.

Sotheby is voiced by Harriet Kershaw in English and [[Itou Miku]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6818083: Default
* !post #6818087: Insight II: World on the Other Side
* !post #6828567: Deep in the Curtains
* !post #7560161: Lawson Collaboration
* !post #8690859: [[Sotheby (The Red Thread of Fate)|The Red Thread of Fate]]

title: suzumiya_haruhi_no_yuuutsu
body:
Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu ([i]The Melancholy of Suzumiya Haruhi[/i]) is a light novel series by Tanigawa Nagaru, with art by [[Ito Noizi]], which was adapted into a 2006 anime by [[Kyoto Animation]], along with a sequel in 2009, and a feature film, [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Shoushitsu]], in 2010. 

It has also been adapted into a number of videos games, drama CDs, and four official manga series. The first, with art by Mizuno Makoto, was considered a disservice and soon cancelled. The second, by Tsugano Gaku, has fared much better. The third is a spin-off based on [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Shoushitsu]], called [[Nagato Yuki-chan no Shoushitsu]], by [[Puyo (puyotopia)|]]. The fourth is a parody manga, [[Suzumiya Haruhi-chan no Yuuutsu]], also by [[Puyo (puyotopia)|]], which saw a 2009 Original Net Animation adaptation by KyoAni.

[i]Nyoro~n Churuya-san[/i], by [[Eretto]], is an unofficial doujinshi work, but was also given an ONA adaptation by KyoAni.

While mainly known as the [i]Suzumiya Haruhi[/i] series, [i]Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu[/i] refers to the first novel of the series, but is used for many of the adaptations, including the anime and manga.

title: priest
body:
A [b]priest[/b] or [b]priestess[/b] is a person having the authority or power to administer religious rites; in particular, rites of sacrifice to, and propitiation of, a deity or deities. Their office or position is the priesthood, a term which may also apply to such persons collectively.

Typically depicted wearing a habit (often a [[cassock]]) alongside accessories like a [[stole]], [[clerical collar]], or [[mitre]].

A Puerto Rican, her streams occasionally fall victim to the island's notoriously poor Internet and power infrastructure.

title: kamen_rider_ex-aid
body:
Titular protagonist of [[kamen rider ex-aid (series)|Kamen Rider Ex-Aid]], twenty-seventh show of the Kamen Rider series and eighteenth of the Heisei generation.

[[Houjou Emu]] is a pediatrics intern at Seito University Hospital, whose double life as the gaming legend "M" attracted the attention of video game developer Genm Corporation, which gave him a Gamer Driver with which he can transform into a Kamen Rider to defeat Bugsters, viruses generated by bugs in Genm software that manifest in the physical world at the expense of their human hosts, even as he has to contend with other Riders who have their own designs for their powers.

As Ex-Aid, Emu uses game cartridge-like Rider Gashats to transform into different forms or summon weapons upgrades.

title: marichka
body:
Marichka (more commonly known as Azov-chan) is a female character designed as the anthropomorphic representation of the [[Azov Battalion]], first appearing in late 2021 amidst rising tensions, and went viral following the start of the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]]. Her real name is "Maria".

Following the war, several characters were created in her wake, representing various Azov-friendly factions within Ukraine and its army, broadly lumped together into the 'Mariverse'. These characters include [[Kraken (japanon)|]], [[Eva (kavunyak)|]], [[Nika (usergore)|]], [[Olesya (miaz)|]], [[Stepan (number-seventeen)|]], [[Levchenko Ahapiia Oleksandrivna]], [[Kupalinka]], [[Cossack (polish anon)|]], [[Emilia Plyaterska]], [[Hanna Kovalchuk]], [[Shefika (usergore)|]], and [[Kenneth del Duca]]. 

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Azov-Chan / Marichka":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/azov-chan-marichka
* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Marichka_Wiki
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/Вікі_Марічка

title: kupalinka
body:
Kupalinka (full name unknown) is a female Belarusian character, member of the [[Kastus Kalinouski Regiment]] within the [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Armed Forces of Ukraine]]. She is one of three Belarusian characters of the [[Marichka|Mariverse]], the other two being [[Emilia Plyaterska]] and [[Paulinka]].

She was designed by an actual Belarusian volunteer in 2022 at the outbreak of the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]], originally as a mere recolouring of Marichka. Paulinka is depicted as having [[brown hair|brown]] [[medium hair]], [[red eyes]], and a [[cz 805 bren|CZ-806 BREN-2]] rifle.

h4. External links

* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Kupalinka
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/%D0%9A%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%96%D0%BD%D0%BA%D0%B0
* "Author's Telegram":https://t.me/SrisovyvausSHI

title: t-64
body:
A second-generation main battle [[tank]] manufactured in Kharkiv, [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[Ukraine]].

First introduced in the 1960s, it was highly advanced for its time, being one of the first tanks to be equipped with composite armor and an autoloader for its 125mm smoothbore cannon, which enabled it to use a three-man crew, keeping the design's weight and size down. It had a compact and powerful diesel engine which gave it superior mobility to the contemporaneous [[T-62]], but had teething problems and its expense prompted the development of the [[T-72]]. Most were originally equipped with an infrared searchlight on the port side of the main gun and had small road wheels.

Notably, it is still in service with the "Ukrainian Ground Forces":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Ground_Forces#Equipment, with various modifications being applied to its tank fleet.

h4. See also

* [[List of ground vehicles]]

h4. External links

title: kamen_rider_build
body:
Titular protagonist of [i][[kamen_rider_build_(series)|Kamen Rider Build]][/i], Sento Kiryu is an amnesiac scientist working for Touto, one of the three governments of a Japan physically and politically split by a massive wall created by the Pandora's Box, a mysterious artifact brought from Mars. Besides scientific work, he also moonlights as Build, fighting off the Smash, mutated humans experimented upon by the mysterious Faust organization.

As Build, Sento uses Fullbottles, which were his own creation, to change his appearance and combat capabilities, using a combination of Fullbottles based on organic and inorganic matter, such as his default blue-and-red RabbitTank form.

title: kamen_rider_ghost
body:
Lead rider of [[kamen_rider_ghost_(series)|Kamen Rider Ghost]], twenty-sixth show of the Kamen Rider series and seventeenth of the Heisei generation.

Tenkuuji Takeru is an aspiring ghost hunter who died protecting his childhood friend Tsukimura Akari from Ganma, creatures hunting after Eyecons, mysterious eyeball-shaped objects, only to be resurrected by a monk who also gives him a device with which, combined with an Eyecon he received from his supposedly-dead father, to transform into Ghost to fight off the Ganma, with the additional task of finding the fifteen remaining Eyecons in 99 days to make his resurrection permanent.

As Ghost, Takeru uses any Eyecon in his possession to summon Parka Ghosts, hooded jacket-like spirits representing famous historical figures, which grant him various combat forms and abilities.

title: kamen_rider_zi-o
body:
Titular protagonist of [[kamen_rider_zi-o_(series)|Kamen Rider Zi-O]], twenty-ninth show of the Kamen Rider series and twentieth of the Heisei generation, as well as the last, with the abdication of Emperor Akihito at the end of April 2019.

Tokiwa Sougo is an eighteen-year-old high-school student prophesied to become a ruthless tyrant by a girl who claims to have come from fifty years in the future. Determined to defy his fate, he takes up the girl's offer to be trained to become a hero instead, becoming Kamen Rider Zi-O to protect the time-space continuum while encountering other Riders from the Heisei era, another Rider from the future determined to kill him before he becomes the prophesied tyrant, and a mysterious organization tampering with the timeline with Another Riders, monsters based on twisted forms of the Heisei Riders.

As Zi-O, Sougo uses Ridewatches to transform into modified forms of past Heisei-era Riders.

title: kamen_rider_fourze
body:
Titular Rider of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (series)|Kamen Rider Fourze]], twenty-second show of the Kamen Rider series and thirteenth of the Heisei generation, as well as a celebration of the series's 40th anniversary.

[[Kisaragi Gentarou|Kisaragi Gentaro]] is a self-styled delinquent and second-year transferee to Amanogawa High School who wants to make friends with his schoolmates. After witnessing an attack by the Zodiarts, constellation-themed monsters derived from human hosts wielding Zodiart Switches, he receives the Fourze Driver from his childhood friend [[Joujima Yuuki|Jojima Yuuki]] and transforms into Kamen Rider Fourze to fight the Zodiarts. Together with Yuuki and reluctant loner [[Utahoshi Kengo]], Gentaro founds the Kamen Rider Club to investigate potential Zodiarts and urban legends involving past Kamen Riders.

Fourze uses Astro Switches, 40 switch-like devices divided among the Switch Sockets corresponding to his arms and legs, of which four must be equipped at once to allow him to transform, and which can be used to equip his limbs with weapons or change his appearance.

title: kamen_rider_wizard
body:
Titular Rider of [[kamen_rider_wizard_(series)|Kamen Rider Wizard]], twenty-third show of the Kamen Rider series and fourteenth of the Heisei generation, as well as the franchise's first magic-based Rider.

[[Souma Haruto]] is the survivor of a magic ritual under a solar eclipse that turned other human sacrifices like him into Phantoms, monsters that feed on their hosts' despair before killing and then imitating them to spread despair in turn. His ordeal granted him the ability to use magic, and with a set of rings and the Wizardriver given to him by a man in white, he sets off to bring hope and fight his fellow Phantoms as Kamen Rider Wizard.

Wizard's combat abilities are affected by Wizard Rings, which are divided into two types: Transformation Rings (on his left middle finger), which change his appearance and elemental specialty (Flame, Water, Hurricane and Land Styles); and Magic Rings (on his right), which give him miscellaneous powers, such as controlling WizarDragon, his personal Phantom.

title: t-72
body:
A family of [[Soviet]] second-generation main battle [[tank]]s of the second half of the [[Cold War]]. Entered production in 1972, it was a further development of [[T-64]]. The T-72 is weighing roughly 41 tonnes, and very small compared to most Western tanks.

With over 30,000 produced, the T-72 was widely exported to numerous countries both in and outside of the Warsaw Pact. Many are still in front line service today, in upgraded variants.

h4. See also

* [[List of ground vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: T-72":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T-72]

title: tactile_paving
body:
Special [[pavement]] with bumps or ridges for the benefit of visually impaired people, used in [[train station|train stations]] and at [[crosswalk|crosswalks]].

First adopted in Okayama city in 1967 and now found in many countries.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tactile paving":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tactile_paving]
* "the six types of patterns for tactile paving":[https://cdn.donmai.us/original/54/04/5404ef3c31a7d9b196d1059e0aee4720.png]

title: anby_demara
body:
Playable character in [[Zenless Zone Zero]] belonging to the Cunning Hares faction.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with a [[side braid]] and [[orange eyes]]. She wears a black-and-green [[vest]] with [[detached sleeves]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] exposing a [[midriff]] where the [[panty straps|straps]] of her [[black panties|panties]] are visible, a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike shorts under skirt|underneath]], [[fingerless gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[sneakers]]. Her weapon is a [[sword]].

Notably, in the beta she didn't wear bike shorts and her panties were directly exposed, but this was altered before release. This version is still sometimes depicted in fanart.

Anby serves as the face and human "mascot" of ZZZ.

Voiced in Japanese by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] and [[Sam Slade]] in English.

h4. Official art

* !post #7826075
* !post #8760110: [[anby_demara_(silver_soldier)|Silver Soldier]]
other_names: アンビー・デマラ绝区零

title: traditional_media
body:
An artwork drawn with traditional tools without a computer. This is in contrast with "digital media" which dominate Danbooru.

Please use this tag only if you're 100% sure that the image is actually drawn by hand. Use [[faux traditional media]]  for digital images that mimic a hand-drawn/non-CG style.

An image that is partly traditional, but also contains digital elements (e.g. digital [[spot color]]), should receive the additional tag [[mixed media]]. Digital filtering, performed to improve the visibility of the traditional artwork (e.g. color adjustment), rather than as a creative effect or to remove flaws, does not make an image [[mixed media]].

A good way to tell if a drawing is traditional is to look for "analog" or アナログ in kana. You'll find this tag on Pixiv and used on some Japanese artists' sites. (Beware however that some people will tag their image "アナログ" that don't qualify to our standards of the tag).

If the image of the work is a photograph of the work, rather than a scanned work, then the tag [[photo (medium)]] is applicable.

For non-drawn physical art, see [[unconventional media]].

h4. Media

* [[acrylic paint (medium)]]
* [[airbrush (medium)]]
* [[ballpoint pen (medium)]]

h4. Examples

* Handdrawn ([b]add[/b] these): post #192450, post #261
* Not handdrawn, but looks like it ([b]don't[/b] add these): post #152272
* Mostly handdrawn, but colored or significantly polished up on computer ([b]add[/b] these, but also tag them [[mixed_media]]): post #152287

body:

[b]Type:[/b] Aqua / Effect
[i]
During your Main Phase: You can Special Summon this card from your hand, and if you do, send 1 monster from your hand to the GY, then, send the top 3 cards of your Deck to the GY. If this card is sent to the GY by card effect (except during the Damage Step): You can Fusion Summon 1 Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, by placing Fusion Materials mentioned on it from your hand, field, and/or GY, including this card from your GY, on the bottom of the Deck in any order. You can only use each effect of "Tearlaments Scheiren" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 1800
[b]DEF:[/b] 1300

Tearlaments Scheiren is a [[mermaid]]/[[siren (mythology)|]]-themed [[duel monster]] in the Starfrost storyline. She wears a {{tiara}} and has [[grey hair]]. Like [[Tearlaments Kitkallos]], her weapon is a sword that have a kaleidoscopic pattern on the blade

She is frequently depicted as a [[tsundere]] in the fanart.
other_names: ティアラメンツ・シェイレーン

title: luca_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
One of the main characters from [[Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's]]. She is the younger sister of [[Lua (yu-gi-oh!)|]]. Known as Luna in the dub.

For a [[duel monster]] that makes up the other half of [[Evil Twin's Trouble Sunny]], see [[Luna (DM) (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]].

title: luna_(dm)_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
The tall, [[dark-skinned female|tanned]], and usually quiet partner of [[Sunny (Yu-Gi-Oh!)|]] and the other half of [[Evil Twin's Trouble Sunny]]. As she currently doesn't have her own monster form, she is currently sharing her Pixiv tag with Sunny.

This tag can be applied if Luna is present on the image. If only Sunny is present, tag [[Sunny (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]] instead.

For a [[Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's]] character known as Luna in the dub, see [[Luca (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]].

title: evil_twin's_trouble_sunny
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] The arch-nemesis of the Evil Twins [[Ki-Sikil (yu-gi-oh!)|]] and [[Lil-La (yu-gi-oh!)|]] online celebrity and phantom thieves. Depicted as a smug and cheeky girl with "ojou-sama" archtypical traits.

She is accompanied by her friend [[Luna (dm) (yu-gi-oh!)|Luna]], who as of current does not have her own duel monster form yet, and therefore shared the same Pixiv tag as Sunny. Because of this, this tag is applicable when either of them is present. If only Sunny or Luna is present, tag [[Sunny (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]] or [[Luna (DM) (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]] respectively. If both were present, then apply this tag and their individual tag.

title: nakiri_ayame
body:

She is an [[oni]] with [[skin-covered horns]], [[red eyes]], a [[fang]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] with a [[red hair|red]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] and [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Her default hairstyle is a [[two side up]] with [[double bun]]s held with a red [[tassel hair ornament|tassel]]ed rope and [[jingle bell|jingle]] [[hair bell|bell]]s with her default outfit and [[center-flap bangs]] [[hair between horns|due to her horns]].

title: ryuushen
body:
An [[androgynous]] [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber]]. Character designed by [[Asasumiboochan]].

They debuted in the first wave of Nijisanji SEEDs, before later being integrated into the main Nijisanji group in December 2018. Their real name is Sengawa Midori. Despite their looks, they're of Japanese descent. They love to sing and would like to make some friends through live streaming.

h4. Appearance

[tn]See post #5596948.[/tn]

They have [[green hair]] and [[red eyes|red]]-[[purple eyes]]. In most situations they're depicted as being [[androgynous]].

Although their hair is always the same color, the style it's in changes often. Sometimes it's [[short hair|short]]. Other times it's [[long hair|longer]] and tied into a [[braid]]. Regardless of the style, an [[ahoge]] is always present.

Their [[ryuushen (3rd costume)|default costume]] is inspired by traditional [[Chinese clothes]]. They wear a [[sleeveless]] [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], a brown [[choker]], and a [[white jacket]] usually worn [[off shoulder]] with sleeves going [[sleeves past fingers|past their fingertips]]. They wear black [[pants]] with a traditional garment around their waist, [[black footwear|black shoes]], and multiple [[ear piercing]]s on both of their ears.

h6. Alternate Costumes

Their [[ryuushen (1st costume)|original]] default costume appears to be even more [[chinese clothes|Chinese]] inspired.

Their [[sleeveless shirt]] is [[white shirt|white]] with a [[red trim]]. A traditional [[multicolored jacket|"jacket"]] is [[black jacket]] with a [[red trim|red]], [[gold trim|gold]], and [[green trim|green]] trim. Their [[pants]] are red at the top and bleed into orange at the bottom.

They wear [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]] have a [[gold trim]].

In August 2020, they were shown in two new costumes.

For one thing, their hair is [[hair down|down]]. They wear a [[panda]] [[animal hood|hoodie]] with a [[black shirt|black]] [[undershirt]]. A red [[choker]] rests over a [[bandaid]] on their neck.

Another [[bandaid]] is on their [[bandaid on cheek|right cheek]]. An [[eyepatch]] is over their left eye.

body:

title: armored_dress
body:
A [[dress]] adorned with combat [[armor]], or an entire suit of armor stylized into a dress.

The armor can be light, such as just [[faulds]] or [[kusazuri]], or it can heavy such as adding [[pauldrons]], [[greaves]], [[gauntlets]], and/or other similar pieces. This ensemble does have elegance in mind, but its primary function is for battle rather than social engagements or festivities.

See [[armored skirt]] if only the [[skirt]] is armored, not the entire dress.

h4. See also

[[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

An [[Erune]] with [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blue hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears a white sideless top along with a [[cape]], a [[blue skirt]] with a [[loose belt]], [[black gloves]], and a [[single earring|single]] [[hoop earrings|hoop earring]] on her left ear. Widely known for her exposed [[armpits]].

Ferry is often seen with her ghosts [[Momo (granblue fantasy)|]], [[Beppo (granblue fantasy)|]], [[Fugee (granblue fantasy)|]], [[Nicola (granblue fantasy)|]], and [[Geegee (granblue fantasy)|]]. Refer to post #3430232 for reference of each ghost.

title: andira_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
2016 Chinese Zodiac character in [[Granblue Fantasy]].

Guardian of the West-Southwest and one of the Twelve Divine Generals, she is the zodiac representative for the Monkey. Often seeing dreams of the utopia her ancestors set out for, she departs on a journey herself after a certain fateful encounter. The unwavering resolve of this monkey goddess makes her an invaluable asset to the crew.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Andira":https://gbf.wiki/Andira

title: kumbhira_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
2018 Chinese Zodiac character in [[Granblue Fantasy]].

Guardian of the North-Northwest and one of the Twelve Divine Generals, she is the zodiac representative for the Boar. Unlike the divine boars before her, she doesn't possess the blessed might of her ilk, but still she ventures into the skies to prove herself worthy. Little does she know that her sincerity and ambition do more for those around her than any amount of strength ever could.

h4.Official alternate costumes

* [[kumbhira (summer) (granblue fantasy)|Kumbhira Summer]]

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Kumbhira":https://gbf.wiki/Kumbhira

title: vikala_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
2020 [[Chinese Zodiac]] character in [[Granblue Fantasy]].

Guardian of the North and one of the Twelve Divine Generals, she is the zodiac representative for the [[year of the rat|Rat]]. Her "yang" side is determined to bring hope, dreams, and wonderment to the world. Her "yin" side wants nothing more than to hide away from it. Caught between two extremes, the divine rat pins her hopes on the wide-open skies and chooses to trust in her new friends.

h4.Official alternate costumes

* [[vikala_(blooming_summer_wallflower)_(granblue_fantasy)|Blooming Summer Wallflower]]

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Vikala":https://gbf.wiki/Vikala

title: vajra_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
2018 Chinese Zodiac character in [[Granblue Fantasy]]. Guardian of the West-Northwest and one of the Twelve Divine Generals along with her partner [[Garjana]].

She is an [[erune]] with [[dog ears]], [[brown eyes]] and short [[blonde hair]] wearing [[Japanese clothes]] with a [[shimenawa]] on her back, [[brown pantyhose]] and [[platform footwear]]; she wields a [[katana]] as her weapon.

Her alternate costume is a green backless pleated dress with a high waist skirt, grey pantyhose, and a yellow jacket with a red ribbon over the dress. Her hair has a French braid along a flower and a green ribbon.

title: geegee_(granblue_fantasy)
body: One of [[Ferry (granblue fantasy)|]]'s ghosts. Small in size and similar in shape to a cat.

title: see-through_raincoat
body:
A [[raincoat]] made of clear, [[transparent]] vinyl or the like, similar in style and material to that used in [[transparent umbrella]]s (which are frequently seen together with these coats). The nature of the style makes it very easy to see what is worn underneath. More explicit images frequently exploit this for characters engaging in [[exhibitionism]] to reveal [[underwear]] or [[nude|nudity]] underneath instead of clothing.

Use this tag for when the raincoat is entirely or largely transparent and easy to see through. This tag isn't intended for garments that are mostly opaque, or translucent due to merely being a thin poncho or the like.

h4. See also

* [[raincoat]]
* [[see-through jacket]]
* [[transparent umbrella]]
* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: kalina_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Girls' Frontline]] character. A logistics officer in the Griffin branch base, her main job is to coordinate resource movements for the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]]. However, due to a lack of manpower in such a distant location, Kalina also carries out the duties of a secretary.

Her standard costume consists of a [[pleated skirt]], dress shirt, a tan [[jacket]], tactical [[gloves]] and [[high heel boots]]. Her [[thighhighs]] are [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]], with one being solid black and the other with black and white stripes.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[orange hair]] made up into a [[side ponytail]].

Kalina has an obsession with money (or in the player's case, gems) and will encourage the player to spend at her in-game shop.

She is cheerful, passionate and casual by nature and is very friendly to the Commander. For the most part Kalina is diligent at her work, but in her private life she has a typical girlish side to her.

She returns in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]] [[aged up]] and wearing a black suit.

Voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

title: m4a1_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[M4 Carbine]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[black eyes|eyes]], with a [[green hair|green]] or chartreuse [[streaked hair|streak]] in her hair. She is typically depicted with an [[armband]], [[thighhighs]], [[scarf]], and a [[jacket]] [[jacket around waist|wrapped around her waist]].

She is the squad leader for the [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|]] Squad (consisting of [[M16A1 (girls' frontline)|]], [[M4 SOPMOD II (girls' frontline)|]], and [[ST AR-15 (girls' frontline)|]]). She is soft spoken and has a conflicting personality, being shy yet strong at the same time. She's looking to change this and become a more capable leader.

Has a much more childish voice in contrast to her appearance. Would receive a [[M4A1 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

She is voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]].

title: st_ar-15_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Colt [[AR-15]] in [[Girls' Frontline]], specifically one by Spikes Tactical.

She has a long [[pink hair]] with [[streaked hair|a blue streak]], a [[one side up|part of her hair tied to the side]] with a [[hair ornament|hairpin that is shaped like a cross-section of an AR-15 quad rail]], and [[blue eyes]]. In her default images she wears a white [[dress]], [[fingerless gloves]] and a [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg. In her 'Literary Girl' skin she wears white [[thighhighs]] and a [[school uniform]]. her rifle's [[magpul]] stock is replaced with a PDW-style stock.

A member of the [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]-led [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], AR-15 is very insecure about being the only civilian model weapon in her team. This goes so far as to her becoming self-conscious when the Commander looks at her trademark. 

Would receive a [[ST AR-15 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

Her illustrator [[LIN+]] adapted her design from his Pixiv Fantasia character, known under many names, who in their last incarnation was known as [[Berlinetta (pixiv fantasia)|]]. She is voiced by [[Katou Emiri]].

title: dandelion_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character in [[Girls' Frontline]].

[spoiler]Originally an OGAS born within [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]'s Neural Cloud, under the influence of the Parapluie virus. Upon the removal of her neural cloud's seals, her OGAS would access a new stage of consciousness and realize it was an entity distinct from M4, yet living in her mind. Believing in the perfection of [[Elisa (girls' frontline)|]]'s Neural Cloud, and wishing to merge with her OGAS as to achieve the perfected form of OGAS, it would try to convince M4 to pursue its interests, believing it to be of benefit to the both of them (referring to M4 as [[Lunasia (girls' frontline)|]] all the while).

After several story developments, during which time it understood it could also access the minds of [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s, during the events of Shattered Connexion, it would assimilate the Isomers of Tallinn, taking over the body of the [[Isomer Hivemind (girls' Frontline)|former Nimogen]] in the process. The assimilation process would mellow out its wishes, and prompt her to finally side with M4. With a physical body now, she would be dubbed "Dandelion" during Chapter 12.
[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #3796865

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Dandelion":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Dandelion]

title: mexican_army
body:
The [[mexico|Mexican]] Army (Spanish: Ejército Mexicano) is the combined land and air branch and is the largest part of the Mexican Armed Forces; it is also known as the National Defense Army.
The Army is under the authority of the Secretariat of National Defense or SEDENA and is headed by the Secretary of National Defence.

It was the first army to adopt (1908) and use (1910) a self-loading rifle, the Mondragón rifle. The Mexican Army has an active duty force of 261,773 men and women in 2024.

title: drawn_together
body:
Drawn Together is an American adult animated sitcom and television series created by Dave Jeser and Matt Silverstein for Comedy Central. 
The series is a parody of house-based reality shows such as The Real World, The Surreal Life, and Big Brother, and follows the misadventures of the housemates in the fictional show of the same name and uses a sitcom format with a reality TV show setting.

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2015)
body:
The 2015 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] version of [[Hatsune Miku]].

Her outfit has a somewhat clerical look with a black and gray theme. She has [[black gloves]], [[black necktie]], [[bangle|bangles]], a black and gray dress with two rows of buttons, and [[neon trim]].

Her official theme song is [[Hand in Hand (Vocaloid)|]] by [[livetune]].

title: hoshi_no_kioku
body:
A 50-minute fan-made [[Touhou]] animated video created by [[SOUND HOLIC]] and released at [[Comiket 73]] in December 2007. Reception was mixed, praising an ambitious project and hiring professional voice actors, but was criticized for being fairly boring with some animation errors. The plot would later be completely invalidated by [[Silent Sinner in Blue]].

Some see it as the predecessor to [[Cookie (touhou)|]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Touhou_Project_Side_Story_~_Memory_of_Stars]

title: avatar:_the_last_airbender
body:
[b]Avatar: The Last Airbender[/b], often abbreviated [b]ATLA[/b], is a [[Nickelodeon]] animated cartoon created by Brian Konietzko and Michael Dante DiMartino.

The story takes place in a world where humans known as benders are able to control and manipulate one of the four elements through [[martial arts]], a practice known as [[element bending|bending]]. The world is divided into four nations represented by each element: the Water Tribe, Earth Kingdom, Fire Nation, and Air Nomads. Peace between them is kept by the Avatar, a powerful bender who is capable of controlling all four elements and is reincarnated after death.

In [b]ATLA[/b], the world has been at war for a hundred years after the Fire Nation attacked the other nations while the Avatar has mysteriously disappeared. In the present, siblings [[Sokka]] and [[Katara]] of the Water Tribe find a boy named [[Aang]] frozen in an iceberg and discover that he is the current Avatar. They join him on a journey to master all four elements and bring balance to the world.

The story is set in a world primarily influenced by Eastern culture and mythology (as well as Inuit), revolving around the reincarnations of the titular Avatar. It would be the beginning of the [[Avatar Legends]] franchise, with its sequel being [[The Legend of Korra]].

Not to be confused with [[James Cameron's Avatar]].

h4. Characters

title: toph_beifong
body:
One of the main characters in [[Avatar: The Last Airbender]].

She is [[blind]] and born in the Earth Kingdom as an earth bender. She joins [[Katara]], [[Sokka]], and [[Aang]] on their journey.

In [[The Legend of Korra]] is it revealed that her daughters are [[suyin beifong|Suyin]] and [[lin beifong|Lin]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] held with a [[hairband]]. She is usually wearing green attire and is [[barefoot]].
other_names: トフ(アバター伝説の少年アン)

title: opal_(legend_of_korra)
body:
A character in [[The Legend of Korra]].

She is the daughter of [[Suyin Beifong]] and the granddaughter of [[Toph Beifong]].

She gained airbending through Harmonic Convergence.

title: lin_beifong
body:
A character in [[The Legend of Korra]].

She is an earth bender and daughter of [[Toph Beifong]]. Her sister is [[suyin beifong|Suyin]].

She is also the police chief of Republic City.
