title: an-94_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Russian [[AN-94]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. One of the members of team [[DEFY (girls' frontline)|DEFY]].

Has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[aqua eyes|aqua]]-[[blue eyes]], although artists make AN-94 [[blonde hair|lightly blonde]] usually, as a result of her original art making it look so by accident, as to make her more distinguishable from [[AK-12 (girls' frontline)|]], who also has [[grey hair]].

[[AN-94 (girls' frontline)|]] is quite reliant on [[AK-12 (girls' frontline)|]], and most commonly seen with [[AK-12 (girls' frontline)|]]. [[AN-94 (girls' frontline)|]] is among the prominent [[flat chest|flat-chested]] characters in [[Girls' Frontline]], although it is far less poked at than [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]] and [[ST AR-15 (girls' frontline)|]]. title: ump40_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP40]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Curiously, one of the few select instances of dolls that can be obtained in-game that are unambiguously considered non-canon, even more so than other cases. [spoiler]She ends up representing three characters in-game as a result: the non-canon acquireable UMP40, who hangs out with [[MP5 (girls' frontline)|]], the canon UMP40 who was [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]]'s sister and died during the Butterfly Incident, and the UMP40 OGAS that developed in UMP45's Neural Cloud on the basis of her memories of UMP40.[/spoiler]

Her original illustrator [[Renatus.Z]] adapted her design from one of his Pixiv Fantasia characters, [[Natius (pixiv fantasia)|]]. Following Renatus' departure, other illustrators have picked her up to do her skins. She is voiced by Uema Umi.

title: g11_(fluffy_dumptruck)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[G11 (girls' frontline)|]]'s ninth skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Childhood Case Files' skin collection from 2023.

Unique to G11 in this skin collection, she has two forms - [[aged down]] in her undamaged art, and [[aged up]] in her damaged art. Both forms possess [[mouse ears]].

When [b]aged down[/b], she wears a [[short sleeves|short]] [[single sleeve]]ed [[white shirt]] [[short over long sleeves|over]] a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black shirt]] - wherein the left sleeve of the black shirt is [[stitches|stitched]] into the sleeveless portion of the white shirt, [[no pants]], [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]] with [[black socks]], and a [[red headband]].

When [b]aged up[/b], she wears the same white shirt and jacket - except [[torn clothes|torn]] and only the left sleeve is barely intact, [[white pants]], [[mismatched footwear|mismatched]] [[slippers]], and the same [[red headband]].

body:
An [[alternate costume]] for [[Girls' Frontline]]'s [[HK416 (girls' frontline)|]], appearing first on the cover of the Japanese-exclusive Dolls' Frontline Official Skin Collection artbook from 2020. Illustrated by [[Imoko (imonatsuki)|]], it is a concept design for what HK416's [[wedding dress]] skin might look like. It never received an official release as a skin, but it did receive a release as a figurine, which granted the dress its name (以月伝心).

HK416 wouldn't get an official wedding dress skin until 2024.

title: kamen_rider_kiva
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_kiva_(series)|Kamen Rider Kiva]], eighteenth show of the Kamen Rider series and ninth of the Heisei generation.

[[Kurenai Wataru]] is a very shy violin maker living in a "haunted house", who only goes out of his mansion to fight as Kiva against Fangires, stained-glass-themed monsters who feed on human souls.

Kiva's red default form is patterned after a vampire. Other forms include the blue, sword-wielding Garulu Form (werewolf), the green, gun-wielding Bashaa Form (gill-man), and the violet, hammer-wielding Dogga Form (Frankenstein's monster). He can also wield the fused DoGaBaKi form, as well as the almighty Emperor Form and its bat-like Flight Style.

title: kamen_rider_decade
body:
The "Destroyer of Worlds".
Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider DCD]], nineteenth show of the Kamen Rider series and tenth of the Heisei generation.

[[Kadoya Tsukasa]] is an arrogant photographer with no memory of his past, driven to save his own dimension by traveling to 9 other dimensions under the protection of the 9 previous Heisei Riders.

Decade has a magenta color scheme, and is based on the shield bug [i]graphosoma lineatum[/i] and barcodes. He can transform into the nine previous Heisei Riders, as well as use their abilities via the Kamen Ride Cards. He can also transform into Decade Complete Form, which can conjure "doppelganger" versions of the nine previous Heisei Riders' final forms.

title: qbz-191_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[QBZ-191]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], QBZ-191 appears as [[Qiongjiu (girls' frontline 2)|]].

A chivalrous Doll who makes for a very trustworthy teammate due to her down-to-earth and level-headed demeanor on the battlefield. She is good at handling all kinds of situations, but she finds it unbearable when she herself becomes someone to be protected. Off the battlefield, her aloofness is replaced by a generous and benevolent spirit that makes her an unexpectedly witty conversationalist. She is extremely popular among Dolls and humans alike, though she doesn't seem aware of her gifts.

Illustrated by [[Imoko (imonatsuki)|]].

title: derek_chauvin
body:
Derek Michael Chauvin is an American former police officer who murdered [[George Floyd]], a 46-year-old African-American man, in Minneapolis, Minnesota. On May 25, 2020, Chauvin knelt on Floyd's neck for about nine minutes while Floyd was handcuffed and lying face down on the street, calling out "I can't breathe," during an arrest made with three other officers. Chauvin was dismissed by the Minneapolis Police Department on May 26 and arrested on May 29. The murder set off a series of protests in Minneapolis–Saint Paul, across the United States and around the world.

Chauvin was a member of the Minneapolis Police Department from 2001 to 2020. In his career, Chauvin had 18 complaints against him in his official record and was involved in three police shootings, one of which was fatal. He received two letters of reprimand for misconduct. He received two medals of valor and two commendation medals during his career.

In early 2021, Chauvin was put on trial for unintentional second-degree murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter of Floyd before a jury in the Minnesota Fourth Judicial District Court. On April 20, he was convicted on all of the charges. On June 25, he was sentenced to 22½ years in prison (with credit given for 199 days time served), with the possibility of supervised release after 15 years (two thirds of his sentence) contingent on factors such as good behavior. Requests to the Minnesota Supreme Court and Supreme Court of the United States for review were denied.

Chauvin pleaded guilty in late 2021 to federal charges of violating Floyd's civil rights by using unreasonable force and ignoring Floyd's serious medical needs. Simultaneously, Chauvin pleaded guilty to violating a 14-year-old boy's civil rights in 2017 by using unreasonable force. In mid-2022, Chauvin was sentenced to 21 years in prison for violating Floyd's civil rights. The federal and state sentences are to run concurrently. The Minnesota Department of Corrections lists Chauvin's anticipated release date on the state sentence as December 10, 2035. For the federal charges, Chauvin will likely be released from prison in the year 2038. Chauvin filed a motion in federal court in mid-November 2023 attempting to vacate his guilty plea.

After the conclusion of the criminal and civil rights cases, Chauvin was transferred in August 2022 from Oak Park Heights prison in Minnesota to FCI Tucson in Arizona, a medium-security federal facility, to serve his sentence. He was stabbed by another inmate at the federal facility on November 24, 2023.

title: george_floyd
body: George Floyd was an African-American man who was killed by police officer [[Derek Chauvin]] in May [[2020]].

title: weibo_username
body:
The artist's Weibo username, added as some form of [[watermark]], [[artist name]], [[web address]], or [[signature]].

Not to be confused with [[Weibo watermark]], which also contains the artist's Weibo name, but is added by the site itself rather than by the artist.

title: patreon_username
body:
The rendering of a page on Patreon found somewhere on an image. The name of the page could be seen in a URL of the page, as just the name next to the [[patreon logo|logo]], or found in a message asking a user to visit the page so long as it's clearly discernible as a Patreon page. Commonly this is a name for the artist or one of their accounts but it does not have to be. If it is a verified name of the artist, tag [[artist name]] as well.

h4. See also

* [[Patreon]]
* [[Patreon logo]]
* [[Web address]]
* [[Watermark]]
* [[Artist name]]

title: twitter_username
body:
A line in or notation on the image that gives out a [[Twitter]] account (usually one belonging to the artist). 

May be used as an alternative to [[signature|signing]] the image if the [[artist_name|name]] is associated with a profile of the artist. May also be a [[Pawoo username]] or other username; the artist entry should be checked to match their profiles.

h4. See also

* [[signature]]
* [[watermark]]
* [[web address]]
* [[Tag group:Text]]

Voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]] in Japanese and [[Suzie Yeung]] in English.

title: oerlikon_20mm_gun
body:
The Oerlikon 20mm [[autocannon]] was one of the most common [[anti-aircraft gun]]s of [[World War II]], used by both Allied and Axis forces on land, installed into aircraft, and mounted onto naval vessels. The latter is where the Oerlikon was most commonly seen, as Allied navies adopted the Oerlikon wholesale to replace smaller-caliber antiaircraft weapons such as the .50 caliber [[Browning M2]] in 1942. However, the rapid pace of wartime aircraft development outpaced the Oerlikon's ability to effectively destroy enemy aircraft, and the gun was withdrawn from service by the end of the 1940s.

It is most often seen in a single mount, though double and even quadruple mounts were developed and used. The Oerlikon can be easily identified visually by the large piston shroud around the barrel that facilitated its blowback operation. Shipboard mounts tended to have a large drum magazine out the top and a curved brace to fit into the operator's shoulders while firing, as well as a gun shield to protect the loaders.

h4. See also
* [[Bofors 40 mm gun]]

title: josephine_mutzenbacher
body: The [[loli]] protagonist of the erotic novel [[Josephine Mutzenbacher or The Story of a Viennese Whore as Told by Herself]]. While fifty-two at the time of her death, the narrative in the novel recounts events between when she was five years old and thirteen years old.
other_names: ヨゼフィーネ・ムッツェンバッヒェル

title: josephine_mutzenbacher_or_the_story_of_a_viennese_whore_as_told_by_herself
body:
[[Josephine Mutzenbacher]] or The Story of a Viennese Whore, as Told by Herself (German: Josefine Mutzenbacher oder Die Geschichte einer Wienerischen Dirne von ihr selbst erzählt) is an erotic novel first published anonymously in Vienna, Austria, in 1906. Its content is entirely pornographic and the book has been banned repeatedly.

The plot is framed as first-person narrative memoir by a soon-to-be-dead prostitute recounting her childhood. The book begins when she is five years old and ends when she at age thirteen begins her career as an unlicensed prostitute in order to support her unemployed father.

body:

Her true identity is Mrs. Snake or the "Snake Wife". A character originating from a variation of the Tsuru no Ongaeshi folktale from which [[Miss Crane_(fate)|]] originates.

In the event, she initially goes by the alias of "Omi-san" until her True Name is revealed.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]] that's [[hair_over_one_eye|covering one eye]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], [[pale skin]] and [[large breasts]], and wears a [[sweater dress]]. title: pacific_rim
body:
[i][b]Pacific Rim[/b][/i] is a 2013 American anime-influenced [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] monster film directed by [[Guillermo del Toro]], written by del Toro and Travis Beacham, and starring [[Charlie Hunnam]], [[Idris Elba]], [[Kikuchi Rinko]], Charlie Day, [[Robert Kazinsky]], Max Martini, and Ron Perlman. 

The film is set in the 2020s, when humanity is under attack by "[[kaiju|Kaijus]]", colossal [[monster]]s which have emerged from the Pacific Ocean. To combat the creatures, humanity unites to create the [[Jaeger (pacific rim)|]]s: gigantic humanoid [[mecha]], each controlled by two or more pilots whose minds are joined by a neural bridge.

A sequel called [[Pacific Rim: Uprising]] was released worldwide in March 2018. An animated series titled [[Pacific Rim: The Black]] was released in 2021.

According to Mexican director Guillermo del Toro, the film was heavily influenced by the old Toho [[tokusatsu]] monster films like [[Godzilla]] as well as classic [[super robot]] anime shows like [[Tetsujin 28-Gou]] and [[Mazinger Z]].

title: melanie_hue_carbine
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985.

[b]Melanie Hue Carbine[/b] is the cunning and ambitious chairman of [[Anaheim Electronics]] during [i]The Gryps War[/i]. 

A crafty and clever "war merchant" who sells [[mobile suit]]s to both sides of the conflict (the [[AEUG]] and the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]), he is known to be shy of the media.
other_names: メラニー・ヒュー・カーバイン

title: re-gz
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Char's Counterattack]] anime film from 1988.

[b]RGZ-91 Re-GZ[/b]

An attempt by [[Anaheim Electronics]] to cheapen and simplify the [[Zeta Plus]] [[mobile suit]] - resulting in the [b]Re[/b]fined [b]G[/b]undam [b]Z[/b]eta, a new MS deployed by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [i]Londo Bell[/i] fleet. 

Omitting the transformation mechanism in favor of a backpack that enabled a simulated [[Wave Rider]] Mode, it ultimately didn't perform as expected, and the data obtained from the two prototypes - one piloted by [[Amuro Ray]] and [[Chan Agi]] - helped to create the first mass production transformable MS of the Federation - the [[ReZEL]].

title: stalker_(helldivers)
body: Enemies from the [[Helldivers (series)|]] franchise. Stalkers are [[Terminid (helldivers)|Terminid/Bug]] specialized in hit-and-run tactics, often dishing out massive damage against an unsuspecting target. They can flee and cloak themselves with a near-invisible camouflage to their surrounding.

title: bile_titan
body: Enemies from [[Helldivers (series)|Helldivers 2]]. An enormous [[Terminid (helldivers)|]] that is said to be the final life cycle stage of a Bile Warrior. It vomits its lethal bile to its target or use is hulking claws to crush them.

title: charger_(helldivers)

title: hive_guard_(helldivers)
body: A medium sized [[terminid_(helldivers)|Terminid]] enemy in the second [[Helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] game. They are a variant of the Warrior boasting a tough hide and specializes in guarding Terminid territory.

title: quattro_bajeena
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] series, [b]Quattro Bajeena[/b] is a male character and supporting protagonist in Mobile Suit [[Zeta Gundam]]. An [[AEUG]] veteran [[mobile_suit|MS]] [[pilot]], Captain Quattro pilots a red [[Rick Dias]], the [[Gundam Mk II]] and the [[Hyaku Shiki]]. He also pilots the [[zero_shiki_(gundam)|Zero Shiki]] and the [[Delta Gundam]] as simulator data.

The official [[Bandai]] romanization of his name is "Quattro Bajeena", and also (humorously) "Quattro Vagina" in several PS1 Gundam games, such as SD Gundam G-Generation F and Char's Counterattack.

In an infamous letter in [[Engrish text|Engrish]] to [[Hayato Kobayashi]] (post #14851), [[Kai Shiden]] writes:

[spoiler][i]"Captain Quattro, he is a CHAR"[/i]: Quattro Bajeena is the pseudonym [[Char Aznable]] uses throughout [[Zeta Gundam]]. Quattro/Char's Hyaku Shiki MS was severely damaged in battle during his final duel with [[Haman Karn]] (in her [[Qubeley]]). Apparently destroyed after Haman defeats Quattro, its wreckage is later shown floating in space with its [[cockpit]] hatch open, implying Quattro/Char's survival of the encounter.[/spoilers]

title: eagle_1_(helldivers)
body: Artist interpretation of the female pilot of [[Eagle_1_(helldivers)|Eagle-1]], the fire support gunship that makes bombing or attack runs when Stratagems are used in [[helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] franchise.  Portrayed as ''extremely'' trigger-happy, especially compared to the pilot of [[Pelican_1_(helldivers)|Pelican-1]].

body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], part of it's [[2nd generation (nijisanji)|]]. 

A very young looking girl who claims to be in her first year of highschool. She's dressed in the image of [[Alice in Wonderland]], with [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] and two [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|hair bows]].

h4. Costumes

title: fu_hua_(herrscher_of_sentience)
body:
A playable [[official alternate costume|battlesuit]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Fu Hua]], reflective of her Classical-era Chinese origins. 

In her base Herrscher of Sentience form, she is portrayed with [[red eyes]] as opposed to her default blue. Her outfit consists of a [[black dress]] with a [[pelvic curtain]] and [[uneven sleeves]] (her right sleeve is longer), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black choker]], golden phoenix [[hair ornament]] on her right side, golden [[earrings]] and [[belt]], and [[black footwear]]. 

She has three other in-game outfits with this battlesuit: Onyx Simurgh, her "Ooh! Summer!" swimsuit, and "Turn Up the Music" rockstar attire, while other outfits are merchandise-exclusives. 

h4. Skins

* !post #4707240: Default

title: zhong_lanzhu
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. She's a transfer student from Hong Kong and fluent in 3 languages (Mandarin, Cantonese, Japanese). She is a very competitive and somewhat arrogant person, though it varies between the anime and ALL STARS.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[two side up]], long [[sidelocks]], [[ahoge]] and [[swept bangs]]. There is a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. Typically, she combines [[Nijigasaki School Uniform|school uniforms]] with a [[black shirt]] and a [[red jacket]] or [[red sweater vest|sweater vest]].

She is a member of [[r3birth_(love_live!)|R3BIRTH]].

Voiced by [[Homoto Akina]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #7411635

* [[Ye Mingzhu (love live!)|]]
* [[Eutopia (love live!)|]]
* [[5201314 (love live!)|]]
* [[PHOENIX (love live!)|]]

title: mia_taylor
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. She is an American college student despite being only 14 years old. Born from a prestigious family of musicians, she's very talented in music and straightforward as a person. 

She has [[blonde hair|blonde]] or [[grey hair|silver]] [[short hair]] [[hair over one eye|that covers her right eye]] and [[purple eyes|purple]]/[[grey eyes]]. She normally wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[letterman jacket]] on top of her uniform. 

She is a member of [[R3BIRTH (love_live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

title: mifune_shioriko
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Elected student council president of Nijigasaki. Her personality in [[Love Live! School Idol Festival All Stars]] is very different compared to in the anime. In-game, she challenges [[Yuki Setsuna]] directly for the position of student council president and initially tries to get the School Idol Club shut down, but in the anime she acts more neutral, briefly helping out with club activities. It's revealed that she secretly admires school idols because of her [[mifune kaoruko|older sister]].

She has [[red eyes|red]] or [[orange eyes|orange eyes]], and a [[short hair|short]] to [[medium hair|medium]] [[green hair|green]]-[[black hair|black]] [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs]] and a small [[hair ribbon]] on the side. She typically has a clearly defined [[fang]]. As the student council president, sometimes she wears a red [[armband]].

She is a member of [[R3BIRTH (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Koizumi Moeka]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #7411619

h4. Character songs
* [[Ketsui no Hikari]]
* [[Aoi Canaria]]
* [[Concentrate! (love live!)|]]
* [[EMOTION (love live!)|]]
* [[Koufukuron (love live!)|]]

title: tennoji_rina
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. She's extremely shy and has trouble expressing her emotions, often covering her face with a [[sketchbook]] (dubbed the "[[Rina-chan Board]]") containing a [[drawing (object)|]] of her face. She has a pet robot cat named [[Aran (love live!)|]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[blunt ends]], [[kishimen hair]] and an [[ahoge]]. Rather than her uniform blazer, she wears a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[sleeves past fingers]] and always carries a [[marker]] in her pocket.

Her birthday is November 13, 2001.

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Tanaka Chiemi]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #7411611

h4. Character songs

* [[Analog Heart (love live!)|]]
* [[Tsunagaru Connect (love live!)|]]
* [[First Love Again (love live!)|]]

title: yuki_setsuna
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Her real name is [[Nakagawa Nana]], with "Yuki Setsuna" being a stage name. She uses that name to hide the fact that she is Nijigasaki's Student Council President (until she is succeeded by [[Mifune Shioriko]] later in the story) and from her family. She's very fond of anime and gaming culture, but she's also very energetic and easily excitable.  

She has [[black eyes|black]] or [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and styled with [[one side up]] and worn with a [[triangle hair ornament]] in her school uniform.

She is a member of [[azuna (love live!)|A・ZU・NA]]. 

Voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]] (2017-2023) and [[Hayashi Coco]] (2023-present).

h4. Appearance
* !post #7523812: with her [[idol clothes]][br]([[Yuki Setsuna (afterschool School Idol)|Afterschool School Idol]])
* !post #7411589: with [[Nijigasaki School Uniform]]

title: konoe_kanata
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Kanata is very sleepy and is prone to taking naps during the day, often carrying a [[pillow]] with her. She is very easygoing and prone to napping in the laps of others.

She has [[large breasts]] and [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]], [[brown hair|brown]] or [[orange hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[red cardigan]] with [[sleeves past wrists]] under her winter uniform and a [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[blazer]] on top of her summer uniform.

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

title: asaka_karin
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Apart from being a school idol, Karin is also an amateur model. She tries to portray herself as mature and having a grown-up seductive charm, but is she's also prone to getting embarrassed and acting childishly.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[blue hair|blue]]-[[black hair]], arranged with [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears [[black pantyhose]] with her school uniform.

She is a member of [[DiverDiva]].

Voiced by [[Kubota Miyu]].

title: osaka_shizuku
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]], Shizuku is a level-headed and mature honor student. She is considered a traditional Japanese beauty, and is quite timid at times. She is also a member of the theater club and dreams of being an actress.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], which she keeps in a [[half updo]] tied into a [[ponytail]] with a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]].

She is a member of [[azuna (love live!)|A・ZU・NA]].

Voiced by [[Maeda Kaori]].

title: uehara_ayumu
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. The [i]de facto[/i] onstage leader of the Nijigasaki School Idol Club, Ayumu is a hardworking girl that puts her everything into what she does. She can be very clumsy at times.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[pink hair|pink]]-[[orange hair]], arranged in a [[half updo]] with [[swept bangs|swept]], [[blunt bangs]]  (often held by [[hairclip]]s) and a [[single side bun]] with a [[bun with braided base|braid wrapped around it]].

She is a member of [[azuna (love live!)|A・ZU・NA]].

Voiced by [[Oonishi Aguri]].

title: annie_(batman)
body:
Annie is a minor female character from an episode of [[The New Batman Adventures]] (Growing Pains).

[spoiler]It is later revealed in the episode that Annie is actually an unaware and disconnected fragment of the shapeshifting [[Clayface]].[/spoiler]

Her appearance is based on [[Mathilda Lando|Mathilda]] from [[leon the professional|Leon: The Professional]].

h4. External links
* "Fandom - Batman: The Animated Series Wiki - Annie":[https://batmantheanimatedseries.fandom.com/wiki/Annie]

title: katsuragi_izumi
body:
A character from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]. She is a first-year in Mizukawa High School. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a [[wolf cut]] and [[orange eyes]] with [[slit pupils]]. Her hair is adorned with two [[triangle hair ornament]]s.

Her first appearance has her wear a [[double-breasted]] [[black coat|black]] [[collared coat|collared]] [[coat]] with [[long sleeves]], and [[black gloves]].

She wears the [[Mizukawa school uniform]] with a [[red necktie]].

[spoiler]She represents Mizukawa in the Love Live! tournament as Edel Note, performing [[Edelied]] in the finals.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Shindou Amane]].

title: mejiro_dober_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Another member of the prestigious Mejiro Family, she has a bad experience with guys that (depending on the trainer's gender in game) acts very hostile to them. Hence in-game she is currently the only one to have a "unique" interaction with her Trainer depending on gender, with her being much comfortable and looking up to the female trainer while having a tsundere-like attitude to the male trainer.

She is also a closet otaku with a talent of shoujo manga which later her depicted with Agnes Digital.

title: dark_magician_girl
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 6
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Spellcaster / Effect
[i]This card gains 300 ATK for every [[Dark Magician]] or [[Magician of Black Chaos]] in either player's Graveyard.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2000
[b]DEF:[/b] 1700

One of the most iconic [[duel monster|duel monsters]] in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] franchise and one of [[Muto Yugi]]'s signature monsters. She is the Duel Spirit of [[Mana (yu-gi-oh!)|]], Mahad's apprentice ([[Mahado|Mahad]] is one of the Pharaoh's priests, whose Duel Spirit is the [[Dark Magician]]). Known as "Black Magician Girl" in Japanese.

Arguably the most famous "poster girl" of the entire franchise, Dark Magician Girl remains an inseparable part of Yu-Gi-Oh!'s identity since her debut in 2001. She has maintained her status as the most popular female character in the franchise for over 20 years, despite the introduction of many other female duel monsters since her first appearance.

h4. Variants
* [[Apprentice Illusion Magician]]
* [[Dark Magician Girl the Dragon Knight|Dark Magician Girl, the Dragon Knight]]
* [[Dark Magician Girl the Magician's Apprentice|Dark Magician Girl, the Magician's Apprentice]]
* [[Magi Magi Magician Gal]]
* [[Palladium Oracle Mana]]
* [[Toon Dark Magician Girl]]

h4. See also
* [[Card Ejector]]
* [[Gagaga Girl]]
* [[Magician's Valkyria]]

title: fascist
body:
An ultra-[[nationalism|nationalist]] and authoritarian ideology first popularized by [[Benito Mussolini]] in [[Italy]] around the 1920s, and then by [[Adolf Hitler]] in [[Germany]] during the 1930s; German fascism is better known as [[Nazi|Nazism]].

Fascists usually promote national and (occasionally) racial supremacy over other countries, are very big believers in "social Darwinism", and seek to maintain or expand the country for the benefit of the "master race" at the other's expense.

h4. See also
* [[Nazi]]
* "Wikipedia: Fascism":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fascism]

title: oboro-maru_(live_a_live)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Twilight of Edo Japan: The Infiltrator chapter. A young shinobi of the Enma Clan, sent on an important mission to rescue a [[sakamoto ryouma (live a live)|prisoner]] from the clutches of [[Ode Iou]], for the sake of Japan's future.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after fighting him.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Hashizume Tomohisa in the 2022 remake.

title: cube_(live_a_live)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Distant Future: The Mechanical Heart chapter. A robot built as an autonomous support unit, he eventually comes to be seen as just as human as the crew.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after finding his battery and inserting it into him.

title: lei_kuugo
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and one of the protagonists of the Imperial China: The Successor chapter. One of the 3 possible successors, alongside [[Yun Jou]] and [[Hong Hakka]] to the Earthen Heart kung fu, representing the martial arts of the skill or spirit.

[spoilers] It is possible for her and one other disciple to die in the Imperial China chapter if either are not leveled up the most.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]She is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), she can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party after fighting her.[/spoilers]

She is voiced by [[Ueda Reina]] in the 2022 remake.

title: hong_hakka
body:

[spoilers]It is possible for him and one other disciple to die in the Imperial China chapter if either are not leveled up the most.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Mizushima Yuu in the 2022 remake.

title: master_shinzanken
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and the main protagonist of the Imperial China: The Successor chapter. An old, dying man looking for a successor to keep his Earthen Heart kung fu alive.

[spoilers]At the end of the Imperial China chapter, he dies after the successor's battle with [[odi wang lee|Ou Di Wan Lee]]. Having taught everything he knows to his successor, he succeeds in his final goal.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Ishimaru Hiroya in the 2022 remake.

body:

title: pogo_(live_a_live)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Prehistory: The First chapter. A young and excitable caveman who learns much more of the world he lives in.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party. Can be recruited without fighting if [[Lei Kuugo]] is the selected protagonist.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Ogata Megumi]] in the 2022 remake.

title: takahara_masaru
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of the Present Day: The Strongest chapter. A wrestler who can learn moves from his rivals. Infamous for being like [[Aqua (Konosuba)|a certain goddess]] and having his Int stat never go up.

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party. Can be recruited without fighting if either [[sundown kid|The Sundown Kid]] or [[cube (live a live)|Cube]] is the selected protagonist.[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Seki Tomokazu]] in the remake.

title: tadokoro_akira
body:

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party.[/spoilers]

title: sundown_kid
body:

[spoilers]He is one of the 8 selectable main protagonists for the Final Chapter: The Dominion of Hate. If others are selected (except for Oersted), he can be recruited as a member of the selected protagonist's party.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Ootsuka Akio]] in the 2022 remake.

title: demon_king_odio
body:
Main antagonist of [[Live A Live]]. Lord of all Demons and the equivalent of a hateful deity, with boundless hate that traverses from the ancient times to the distant future.

[spoilers]At the end of the Middle Ages chapter, it is revealed that [[Oersted]] renounced his former ties and titles from Lucrece and took on the name "Odio", becoming the next Lord of Dark after losing the faith of those he loved and a lack of those to believe in him. One of the playable characters for the Final Chapter if Oersted is chosen as the protagonist.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] in the 2022 remake.

title: kamen_rider_double
body:
Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider W]], twentieth show of the Kamen Rider series and eleventh of the Heisei generation.

Self-proclaimed "hard-boiled" private eye [[Hidari Shoutarou]] and his enigmatic assistant [[philip_(kamen_rider)|Philip]] combat Dopants, humans turned into monsters via [[Gaia Memory|Gaia Memories]] to wreak havoc in the city of Fuuto, using their "true" Gaia Memories and the Double Driver to merge into Double.

Double has two halves split down the middle, with Shotaro forming the body and left half, and Philip the mind and right half. Each half has 3 forms, making for 9 combinations, of which the most prominent is CycloneJoker. Other forms include FangJoker (where Philip becomes the body and Shotaro being the mind) and CycloneJoker Xtreme (with both men merged as one).

title: kamen_rider_skull
body:

Kamen Rider Skull's head resembles a human skull wearing a white fedora and a muffler around his neck.

body: Kamen Rider Diend is the secondary Rider of [[kamen_rider_dcd|Kamen Rider Decade]]. Diend has a cyan-and-black color scheme and is patterned after a [i]zicrona caerulea[/i], a cerulean species of shield bugs (Decade is patterned after the pink [i]graphosoma lineatum[/i]), as well as barcodes.

title: kamen_rider_kuuga_(ultimate_form)
body:
[[Kamen Rider Kuuga]]'s final form. In this form, he gains a black-colored body with [[spikes]] on the shoulders, forearms and lower part of the legs, a headpiece with [[multiple horns|five horns]], a mouthpiece with sharp, fanged design, and the Amadam stone in the [[rider belt|Arcle]] is now black-colored. The eyes has differing colors as a sign if Kuuga is in full control of his powers in this form or not: [[red eyes|Red]] (similar to Mighty Form) for the former, and [[black eyes|black]] for the latter. 

This form is also the combination of all of Kuuga's previous forms' power without the weaknesses present on them (such as Pegasus Form's sensory overload) and his parameters are much higher, becoming as powerful as [[N-Daguva-Zeba]]. He also has the ability to use any of his previous forms' weapons and possess some abilities that Daguva also uses, such as [[pyrokinesis]], the ability to see human forms of every Gurongi, and the ability to break defenses no matter how strong they are and draw blood in his attacks. It is said that his finishing move, the [i][[rider kick|Ultimate Kick]][/i], can destroy the world if used at full power.

However, using this form puts Kuuga at risk of losing control and becoming a monster bent on destruction like Daguva. It can only be fully controlled if he possess a pure heart. 

Being the first Final Form of the Heisei-era Kamen Riders and beyond, succeeding Riders' Final Forms are also nicknamed "Ultimate Form/s" in its honor.

title: rope_braid
body: A distinctive style of [[braid]] that twists the hair when braiding, resembling a rope. "Rope braid" usually refers to a two strand twist, where two strands of hair are twisted together. However, a similar look can also be achieved using other numbers of strands. For example, a three strand twist is a braid where three strands of hair are twisted together. Occasionally a single strand of twisted hair can also result in a similar look. These are not always distinguishable by eye. For tagging purposes, all of them are considered rope braid.

title: upside-down_kiss
body:
A [[kiss]] where one of the character's heads is completely upside-down. 

[[Spider-Man]] and [[Mary Jane Watson]]'s kiss in the rain from [[Spider-Man 1 (2002)|]] is arguably one of the most recognizable and parodied examples of this type of kiss.

Don't use this tag for generic [[rotational symmetry]].

title: queen_never_cry_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a panel of the Webtoon [[manhwa]] [i]The Ki Sisters[/i]. In the manhwa's chapter 34, the character Queen Serina whispers to her crying newborn child, Laura "Queen never cry", causing the infant to immediately calm down much to the confusion of the doctors watching her.

The panel has since gained derivation.

It also has a [[Galarian zigzagoon|Galarian counterpart]].

Next Pokémon: [[Linoone]]
